variant.question: In accordance with EASA Flight Crew Licence requirements, the credit for multi-pilot aeroplane co-pilot time is..

options.text: 100% of the co-pilot flight time towards the total flight time required for a higher licence class.
100 hours of the flying time required for a higher licence class.
50% of the co-pilot flight time towards the total flight time required for a higher licence class.
75% of the co-pilot flight time towards the total flight time required for a higher licence class.

variant.question: At what age a pilot cannot act as a commercial pilot anymore?
The restrictions placed on an ATPL holder for commercial air transports with an age of 60 - 64 years, are:

options.text: Multi-pilot crew operations only.
May only fly single-pilot operations.
No restrictions as long as the other crew member is younger than 40.
May still fly commercial air transport operations as long as the other pilot is the captain.

variant.question: An applicant for a commercial pilot licence (CPL) shall have completed in aeroplanes not less than:

options.text: 10 hours of instrument instruction time of which not more than 5 hours may be instrument ground time.
15 hours of instrument time of which not more than 5 hours as pilot in command.
20 hours of instrument instruction time of which not more than 5 hours may be instrument ground time.
20 hours of instrument instruction time of which not more than 10 hours may be instrument ground time.

variant.question: According to the relevant FCL requirements, the applicant for an aeroplane Commercial Pilot Licence shall have completed in aeroplanes, not less, than..

options.text: 20 hours of VFR cross country flight time as pilot-in-command including a cross country flight of not less than 540 km / 300 NM.
30 hours of VFR cross country flight time as pilot-in-command including a cross country flight of not less than 540 km / 300 NM.
15 hours of VFR cross country flight time as pilot-in-command including a cross country flight of not less than 540 km / 300 NM.
25 hours of VFR cross country flight time as pilot-in-command including a cross country flight of not less than 540 km / 300 NM.

variant.question: Which restrictions apply to licence holders aged between 60 and less than 65 in commercial air transport?

options.text: Multi-pilot crew only.
Multi-pilot crew only and the other flight crew member must be younger than 60 years.
Multi-pilot crew only and the other flight crew member has to be a Captain.
No restrictions if the other crew member is younger than 40 years.

variant.question: Which restrictions apply to licence holders aged between 60 and less than 65 in commercial air transport?

options.text: Multi-pilot crew only.
Multi-pilot crew only and the other flight crew member has to be a Captain.
No restrictions if the other crew member is younger than 40 years.
Multi-pilot crew only and the other crew member has to be a Co-pilot

variant.question: What is the PART-FCL definition of "night time"?

options.text: The hours between the end of evening civil twilight and the beginning of morning civil twilight or such other period between sunset and sunrise, as may be prescribed by the appropriate authority.
The period between sunset and sunrise.
The hours between the end of evening civil twilight and the beginning of morning civil twilight or such other period between sunset and sunrise.
The hours between 30 minutes before the evening civil twilight and 30 minutes after the morning civil twilight or such other period between sunset and sunrise.

variant.question: According to EASA FCL: The holder of a pilot licence who has attained the age of ___ years shall not act as a pilot of an aircraft engaged in commercial air transport.

An applicant for a commercial pilot licence-aeroplane (CPL-A) shall have completed not less than ___ hours of cross-country flight time as pilot-in-command including a cross-country flight totaling not less than ___, in the course of which full stop landings at two different aerodromes shall be made. The hours and distance referred to are:

According EASA AIRCREW regulation, the minimum and maximum age of the pilot 
holding a CPL for aeroplanes or helicopters is:

options.text: 18 and 64 years.
18 and 60 years.
21 and 65 years.
21 and 64 years.

variant.question:
Multi-pilot aeroplanes. An applicant for the first type rating course for a multi-pilot aeroplane shall be a student pilot currently undergoing training on an MPL training course or comply with - among others - the following requirement:
Have at least ___ of flight experience as PIC on aeroplanes.

options.text: 70 hours
100 hours
200 hours
55 hours

variant.question: According to SERA, what documents shall a flight crew member carry when performing a flight?

options.text: A valid flight crew licence, a valid medical certificate and a form of photo ID.
A valid flight crew licence, updated time records, passport, VISA.
A valid flight crew licence, updated time records, insurance records.
A valid flight crew licence, updated time records, a valid photo ID.

variant.question: An applicant for a commercial pilot licence-aeroplane (CPL-A) shall have completed in aeroplanes not less than ___ if the privileges of the licence are to be exercised at night.

options.text: 5 hours of night flight time including 5 take-offs and 5 landings as pilot in command
5 hours of night flight time including 3 take-offs and 3 landings as pilot in command
5 hours of night flight time including 3 take-offs and 5 landings as pilot in command
5 hours of night flight time including 5 take-offs and 5 landings either as pilot in command or as co-pilot

variant.question: After a flight crew licence holder, engaged in multi-pilot commercial operations, reaches his/her 40th birthday, medical assessments are every

options.text: 12 months.
9 months.
6 months.
3 months.

variant.question: At what age shall a person NOT act as a pilot in command of aeroplanes or helicopters engaged in commercial air transport?
With regard to EASA Part-FCL, explain the term ‘competent authority’:

options.text: The competent authority shall be an authority designated by the Member State to whom a person applies for the issue of pilot licences or associated ratings or certificates.
In Europe, EASA is the competent authority, designated by the European Member States to whom a person or company applies for the issue of pilot licences and airworthiness certificates.
The competent authority shall be an authority designated by all Member States.
The competent authority shall be an authority designated by EASA to whom a person applies for the issue of international accepted type ratings.

variant.question: What is the validity for a Class 1 medical certificate for a licence holder who is 62 years of age?

options.text: 6 months
24 months
36 months
12 months

variant.question: According to EASA Flight Crew Licence requirements, the minimum age for an applicant for a Commercial Pilot Licence is..

options.text: 18 years of age.
17 years of age
16 years of age.
21 years of age.

variant.question: The correct EASA PART-FCL definition for multi-pilot aircraft with regards to aeroplanes is:

options.text: Aeroplanes certificated for operation with a minimum crew of at least two pilots.
Aeroplanes certificated for operation with a crew of one or two pilots.
Commercially operated aeroplanes certificated for operation with a minimum crew of at least two pilots.
Commercially operated aeroplanes certificated for operation with a crew of one or two pilots.

variant.question: According to the relevant FCL requirements, one of the privileges of the holder of an aeroplane Commercial Pilot Licence is to act as pilot-in-command on any..

options.text: aeroplane engaged in operations other than commercial air transportation.
aircraft.
aeroplane certificated for single pilot operation other than in commercial air transportation.
aeroplane engaged in commercial air transportation.

variant.question: According to Part-FCL, what documents shall always be carried by the pilot when exercising the privileges of the flight crew licence?

options.text: The pilot’s valid flight crew licence, his/her valid medical certificate, and a personal identification document containing his/her photo.
The pilot’s valid medical certificate, a recent passport photo, and up-to-date flight time records.
The pilot’s valid flight crew licence, his/her up-to-date flight time records, and a valid personnel personal identification document containing his/her photo.
The pilot’s valid flight crew licence, his/her valid medical certificate, a recent passport photo, and up-to-date flight time records.

variant.question: A person of 13 years of age is defined as

options.text: an adult.
a child.
an adult if female only.
an adult if male only.
